general_info.description: Facts that identify the course and how/where it is taught.

course_title.description: Official course title in the document’s language.

instructor.description: Primary instructor/lecturer name exactly as printed.

teaching_semester.description: Term/semester the course runs (e.g., Fall, Spring).

semester_of_studies.description: Which study semester this course belongs to (e.g., 2nd).

autonomous_teaching_activities.description: Summary of the main teaching activity and load.

activity_type.description: Label of the activity (e.g., Lectures, Labs).

weekly_teaching_hours.description: Weekly contact hours for the activity.

course_type.description: Category such as Core, Elective, Skills Development, etc.

prerequisite_courses.description: Course codes/titles that must be completed beforehand, if listed.

language_of_instruction_and_exams.description: Language(s) used for teaching and assessment.

offered_to_erasmus_students.description: Yes/No or note about availability to exchange students.

course_objectives.description: What students are expected to achieve and the broader competencies trained.

learning_outcomes_text.description: Free-form text with the learning outcomes exactly as written (multiple paragraphs allowed).

general_competencies.description: Bullet list of generic competencies/skills (each item one bullet).

course_content.description: One large string that preserves the listed topics/units in order (bullets or lines).

student_evaluation.description: How the course is delivered, workload, and how students are assessed.

delivery_mode.description: Mode of delivery (e.g., face-to-face, blended, distance).

use_of_ict.description: Tools/platforms used (e.g., email, LMS, course website).

learning_activities_and_workload.description: Named activities with estimated hours (e.g., Lectures 52, Study 50).

total_workload_hours.description: Sum of all hours if given.

assessment.description: Assessment language and components with weights/notes.

components.description: Each assessment element with its contribution (percent or note such as bonus).

suggested_bibliography.description: Single free-form field that captures any bibliography section exactly as shown (recommended books, instructor notes, related journals, etc.). If there are headings/subsections, keep them inline as text.
